title: Nurse Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC)
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview. It did not last very long. I was asked a few questions and the lady was extremely nice. The questions were the typical questions and she was very receptive to my answers.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths that are applicable to the job?

title: Materials Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Cone Health (Burlington, NC) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: easy initial phone interview with standard interview questions. lasted less than 30 minutes, they go over experience and your resume and why you applied for the position, previous work, etc.should progress to an in person interview next?
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself? times you went above and beyond at work? times you helped another employee?

title: Practice Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is pretty fast, however the wait to contacted by recruitment can be a little lengthy. There is typically a panel interview with 3 people from differ departments within Cone!!
Interview Questions: What skill sets can you offer the company?

title: Nurse Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cone Health
Interview Descriptions: first interview with recruiter was not bad! Followed up with interview with the director then was asked to shadow. The first interview was only about 15 minutes whereas the second lasted a little longer.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a difficult situation?

title: Sourcer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: I received a message on LinkedIn from someone on their sourcing team. I scheduled a call with the sourcer and had the phone screen. After the phone screen, she asked me for a copy of my resume to pass on to the hiring manager. The hiring manager reached out to me to schedule an interview. I had an interview with two other members of the team. I was told that I would hear back in a week after the interview. I sent my customized thank you notes to each of the interviewers and was told a decision would be made in a week. I followed up after not hearing back from the hiring manager after two weeks, and then the hiring manager said the job was on hold. The following day, I got the rejection email, which I didn't even read. If an email says "Thank you for your interest", I don't even bother to read it.  I currently work at a larger healthcare organization with an advanced ATS and 3 times as many recruiters and have worked in all aspects of HR, with the majority of it being in recruitment and they still didn't pick me, smh. Their loss.
Interview Questions:
What does customer-obsessed mean to you?
Name a time that you went "out of the box" to source a candidate.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Cone Health (Burlington, NC) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview questions and job shadowing. Simple questions to let interviewers get to know you and your personality and work style. Scenario questions involved to your job title and how you would handle certain situations or react in certain ways in different scenarios.
Interview Questions: What interest you in this position?

title: Nurse Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview 30 minutes long. Asks certain interview questions and where you want to go with your career. Asks previous experience those sorts of questions 
Second phone interview set up with clinical nurse
Interview Questions:
Where do you see yourself in 5 years
Explain current and past experience working in healthcare
What motivates you
What do you know about Cone Health

title: New Grad RN Academy Interview Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview lasts around 30 minutes and for the most part it is really laid back. They start by telling you a little about the Residency and then get into the interview questions. They are situational so recall your experiences. Know the values of the company because that is part of one of the questions ;-)
Interview Questions: Knowing what our values are (for Cone) Name a time that you had a difficult patient and "how" did you handle this situation.

title: Exercise Physiologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cone Health in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Upon applying you have one general interview with a talent agent and if you are chose to be considered further for the position you will have one interview with the department head.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths in this field.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cone Health
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard interview process. Phone screening through recruiter for the first step then in person interview with hiring manager and team. The entire process probably took about a month or so
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions like tell me about a time....

title: Nurse Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cone Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview  and interview with the department leaders then with the PR and I got the job. It wasn’t a difficult process just a long process, feedback takes time but if you get the job
Interview Questions: When did you exceed a patient expectations

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cone Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process I experienced here was the worst and most unprofessional of my entire career. They showed zero respect for me and treated me as if my time was of no value. They jerked me around for nearly two months for a job that had already been offered to an internal candidate. I did two interviews and then was introduced to the entire team. I was asked to come in and shadow the team, which was scheduled two and half weeks out from the time of the interview because they said they wanted to make sure I would get the chance to fully experience the role. I passed up other opportunities because I was genuinely excited about the job and they gave me every reason to believe I would most likely receive an offer. I came in on the scheduled date and shadowed multiple team members over the course of about four hours. I was then told I would hear from them within 1-2 weeks. At the end of two weeks, I called to ask if they had made a decision. I was told that they preferred to hire internally, had already offered the job to an internal candidate, and had been waiting all this time for that person to make a decision. Since that person had just accepted, I was no longer being considered. So basically, they had me interview multiple times and then do four hours of unpaid training for a role I was never seriously considered for in the first place. I understand interviewing multiple candidates for a role, but to keep someone on the hook for so long just to give your intended candidate more time to decide if they even want the role is unprofessional and disrespectful. If you interview here, be aware that they have a preference for internal candidates and will go out of their way to waste your time if it best suits their needs.
Interview Questions:
-Tell me about a time you exceeded a patient's expectations.
-Tell me about a time you went above and beyond to help a coworker.
-What are your career goals?
-List 3 strengths.
-What is an opportunity/challenge for you?
-How do you define a team?
-How would you approach a team member who is not pulling their weight?
-Where do you want to be in 5 years?
-How do you deal with a difficult patient?
-How do you deal with a difficult doctor?
-Tell me about yourself and what led you to be interested in this role.

title: Pt Access Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cone Health
Interview Descriptions: First, I had a phone interview with a talent acquisition person. After the phone interview, I got to do an interview with supervisors.  That was through a video interview via webex
Interview Questions: What do you know about cone health?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cone Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied to the New grad residency program. The interview consisted of a  panel with three RN’s from various departments. They were very welcoming and laidback. Overall the process was very welcoming.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cone Health
Interview Descriptions: It was relatively easy, not very stressful. Nice people to have a conversation with. Interview went smooth and nice. They got  back to me an offer in about a week later.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses and strengths?

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very Rude interview, unable to get an accurate gauge of benefits of salary and interviewer became defensive and evasive when asked about salary and relocation aid. As I am not from that state I thought it only prudent to ask about such things
Interview Questions: What is your desired field of future study?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with a member of Cone Health Talent Acquisition, that lasted about 15 minutes. He was very easy to talk to and the interview was a pleasant experience. He asked a few questions, and he then determined that the pay range for this particular position was less than what I was looking for. He said that he would keep an eye out for other better paying Admin. positions that came up.
Interview Questions: Can you describe a time where you went above and beyond for a co-worker?

title: Nutrition Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: 2 part process. Phone interview then in person interview. Asked basic and easy questions. Pretty easy. Interviewer was nice and kind. Phone interview was just a pre-screening, asked availability and some easy interview questions.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with change?

title: Nurse Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Obvious she didn’t read my resume. Used every method to talk me OUT of the job. I have a 4 yr college degree, who wouldn’t want to hire me. Process took 4 months
Interview Questions: When did you exceed a patients expectations

title: Nurse Tech1 Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: First applied online. Then received an e mail to schedule a phone interview with a talent acquisition team member. After my first phone interview she told me she thought I would be a great fit and she then set me up a WebEx interview. I then completed the web interview with one of the unit coordinators. She was very sweet and invited me to come in and shadow the next day. When I came into shadow everyone was so nice. I was supposed to just be observant......but I like to get my hands dirty so I decided to put myself to work lol. I shadowed for 3.5 hours and at the end was offered a position.
Interview Questions: What is a characteristic about yourself, that a fellow employee might misinterpret.

title: Nurse Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cone Health in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had 2 interviews, one with the recruiter, and then was scheduled an interview with the unit leaders on Webex. it took a while before I got feedback. The interview was not hard just be yourself and you should be fine.
Interview Questions: one time you have exceeded your patient expectations

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cone Health
Interview Descriptions: Participated in the talent pool being held in Greensboro on November 20, 2020. All candidates were seated 6 ft apart per COVID. We will all called individually to be interviewed and did not touch anything to ensure our safety during the process. Interview conducted in a panel style with two people in the room.
Interview Questions:
Where would you give an infant under 2 a shot?
What are the 5 rights?
Where is a IM injection given?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied for job, got interview two weeks later, it went well and now waiting to see if i will be getting an offer for employment. i had to end up doing a zoom interview because of covid but it worked out well.
Interview Questions: why do you want to leave your current employer

title: Or RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cone Health in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: They assign you a recruiter who does most of the scheduling with the managers but they do not communicate very well with each other. The head doesn’t let the tail know what’s going on! I  tried again and they didn’t even show up for the virtual interview. They seem clicky  and you have to know someone to get in.
Interview Questions: Behavior based and situational based questions

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cone Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and talked to a recruiter on the phone. Next I schedule a panel interview and I got an offer 2 days later. The panel interview had 3 people and it was very informal
Interview Questions: How did you handle a situation with a difficult patient?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed for the new grad RN academy. It was a panel of 4 nurses that were directors or assistant directors of a unit that was relevant to the academy you were interested in. Everyone involved with the process from the time to arrive until you leave was very nice and there was a pretty relaxed feel throughout the interview. It had sort of a conversational feel to it where they would ask you questions and then maybe pick up on something you said and ask you a question based off your response. Everyone that I have spoke to in my class has had the same experience during their interview process.
Interview Questions: Tell us a little bit about yourself, what got you interested in nursing?

title: Registerd Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cone Health in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: The process was a very professional and easy overall experience.  Everyone is very helpful during the process.  After applying I got a request to do a phone interview within days.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about yourself?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: it was easy, had interview within a couple of days of filling out the application. the process is long, but i was happy with getting in to Cone health . the recruiter keep inform for each step
Interview Questions: What was my background in Customer Services

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, wonderful, made me feel comfortable. It was a very professional interview and the interviewer made me feel more comfortable. Cone health is such a wonderful organization. any opportunity with them would be a one in a lifetime opportunity to grow and learn
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 3 to 5 years

title: Nutrition Services Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cone Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied online which consisted of a personality test. Next was the Phone interview where they ask a few pre screening questions. Then I got an invite for an in person interview that lasted about 15-20 minutes.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time where you had to overcome a challenge and how you you overcame it

title: Weekend Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cone Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a request the next day for a phone interview. I selected a time that worked best and then was contacted by a recruiter. The interview lasted about 15 minutes - it was very one sided and not conversational. It seems like they are just looking for answers to pass on to a hiring team.
Interview Questions: How are you at multi-tasking?

title: Wellness Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cone Health in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Received a phone interview and the next week I was offered a face-to-face interview. About 1 week and a half later, I was offered a second interview. The first face-to-face interview was just myself and the Hiring Manager. The second interview was the Hiring Manager and a team member.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?
How does your education and experience align with the position?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cone Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview with Director in offer as a 1:1 with questions asked about why I want the job and would be a good fit for the position. The interview process was straight followed and typically for the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work on this unit?

title: Nurse Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick and painless. I was emailed on to schedule a ohone interview which I was able to get only 2 days out. The actual interview was simple and not what I had expected which was over the top questions.
Interview Questions: What are 3 qualities you look for in this job?

title: Nurse Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an online application, then I received an email with instructions to call in for an interview.  I recorded responses to four questions, similar to leaving a voice mail.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time you exceeded your patient's expectation of care.

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: It’s a long process. Takes 3 rounds of interviews and a lot of paperwork and waiting. It was pretty standard in my line of work. Sometimes, the recruiter takes awhile to get back to you.
Interview Questions: Describe a day to day in your current field.

title: Lpn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: It took over 6 weeks to receive a call. I had applied for a PRN job, I was unaware that the job would always be on call and not a schedule. The interview process was fine, I talked to a hiring manager on the phone then I was asked did I want to move forward to the next interview but I declined.
Interview Questions: What was a time that I felt overwhelmed and how did I handle that?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Cone Health in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Supervisor never met with me, called once then got a generic rejection.  I spoke with a talent acquisition person and they were not able to provide me an explanation about why I did not receive the job.
Interview Questions: What is your preferred shift.

title: Registered Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cone Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was in three parts.  It started with a scheduled phone interview with talent acquisition, progressed to an interview with the manager, and eventually interviewed with the team.
Interview Questions: Name a time that I made a mistake and what I learned from it.

title: Nurse Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was just being myself. We basically had an ordinary conversation. That lead into my skills and what i was looking for in working with the company. The interviewer was very friendly and down to earth and made me feel welcomed.
Interview Questions: How long have you been a nurse?

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cone Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview was about 40-50 mins long including the tour of the hospital. Manager of radiology and supervisor were the ones who asked questions. The vibe was really casual and conversational.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Moses Cone Hospital?

title: Nutrition Svcs Ambassador APH Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cone Health (Madison, NC) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Online, wasn't even a person, it was a automated voice that asked me 5 questions, had 2 minutes for each question. The questions I answered for the job wasn't at all related.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: New Grad RN Academy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had a quick phone interview then was asked to schedule a panel interview at the end of the phone interview. The panel interviews were over 4 different days and I picked a time and day out of the options. I received a call a week later offering me the position.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you went out of your way for a patient during clinicals.

title: Director Cancer Center Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cone Health in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview contains a portion where they allow the staff to interview you. This portion was very different than anything I have ever experienced.  It felt more like an interrogation.
Interview Questions: Lesdership skills and management of people

title: Vascular Sonographer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: HR representative asked a series of general questions about character,  verify work history,  tattoos and piercings,  if currently interviewing with other companies who are they and how much salary  are they offering.
Interview Questions: Are you interviewing other companies and their salary offer?

title: New Graduate RN Academy Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cone Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received an email to schedule a phone interview within a week.  Phone interview questions included my favorite and least favorite clinical rotation, time I've dealt with a difficult patient, time I went out of my way to help a coworker, any community service work, which academy I want (medsurg, critical care, etc) and why, and finally why I thought I was a good candidate for the academy.  I scheduled a face to face interview while doing phone interview.  Face to face interview went very smoothly and was over within less than 15 minutes.  Interviewers were extremely nice and made me feel very comfortable.  I was notified within 3 days that I got the offer and some others received emails who were denied.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Cone?

title: Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Once I applied online I was then emailed to set up a time for a phone interview. Once the time was set up I completed a phone interview which lasted about 30 minutes and then was asked to come in for a panel interview.
Interview Questions: "Why should we hire you"

title: Environmental Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very tricky  but also kind of difficult because you don't know what to expect from the person your speaking to from the hiring department. Once the phone interview starts you kind of just go with the flow of the things
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Assistant Gift Shop Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cone Health
Interview Descriptions: First interviewed by a man that asked irrelevant questions and didn't care about my extensive knowledge. 2nd part met w/ store manager, immediately became apparent she hadn't read my resume.
Interview Questions: Have you ever worked with, and/or would you be ok working with someone over 60?

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email 20 days later to fill out a survey/test and schedule a phone interview. A week after the phone interview I received an email saying that they found someone better fit for the job.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you went out of your way to help someone?

title: New Graduate Nurse Academy Interview Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Easy. Applied online, interviewed with a recruiter over the phone, invited to second interview over phone and via email after phone interview. Second interview was in-person with a panel. Wear business attire. All candidates were interviewed on the same day. My panel included two individuals, some interviewees had four interviewers. They asked maybe about 4 to 5 questions and had a score sheet. They were so kind and it was easy overall just go in confident. I was offered a position same day about 3 to 4 hours after the interview but declined later due to family issues and I had an offer closer to home.  I would have loved to work for Cone, I don't think you could go wrong by accepting. They are amazing individuals and have a lovely facility. Good luck.
Interview Questions: What is one characteristic that people and/or co-workers misinterpret.

title: Assistant Director of Nursing Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with other assistant directors as well as the director that I would work for.  I also interviewed with the staff and the CNO. The interviews were pretty casual.
Interview Questions:
"Why are you interested in this position"?
"What are your strengths and weaknesses"?
"What can you bring to the position"?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC)
Interview Descriptions: The best advice I can give any nurse interviewing at Cone Health is NEGOTIATE. I walked away twice and on the third interview they offered me much more than the number I had in my mind. They will try to tell you "this is what we pay for this many years of experience", but don't buy it. They are currently offering a VERY SUBSTANTIAL sign on bonus, and there is a reason for that. Cone is desperate for nurses, so use that to your advantage! The honest truth is that Cone is the worst health system I've worked for in my almost 30 years of nursing, so that pay rate is going to be your incentive to put up with a whole lot of nonsense and negativity.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict?

title: Admission Services Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview broken into 3 parts. First Interview consists of a phone interview where they ask basic customer service questions. Second part consists of a data entry test, where they test your typing skills and accuracy. Last Interview consists of meeting with the manager, supervisor and team lead where they ask why you believe you would fit in this role and other typical interview questions.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult patient?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Very quick process. I applied online, had a phone interview then an in person interview with a panel of nurse managers. They offered me the job within a week of the interview. Great experience.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cone Health in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Several interviews. Open ended questions. 3 interviews until job offer. Talked to staff and management tour of department. Waited 1 weeks and offered position. Drug testing the same as other healthcare companies. Orientation and several days of orientation.
Interview Questions: How did you learn about the position

title: Nuclear Medicine Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Met with management one on one, very laid back, asked about knowledge of procedures to be performed and how to handle patient questions/concerns, also met with the group I wold be working with
Interview Questions: Asked to explain procedure as if interviewer was the patient.

title: Front Desk Agent Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was brief  but they really make sure your a fit for the team. They interview you first and if they see your a fit then they call and see if you can take the typing test and if you pass that. Then the process it taken to HR
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cone Health (Naples, FL) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Multiple telephone interviews with personnel from the hospital as well as the parent company, CHS.  Great sense of urgency on their part initially as position was vacant for a long time then a long silence before hearing back from them again.  In person interview scheduled at short notice.  Interview process went well and I liked everyone I met.
Interview Questions: What types of difficult physician situations have you had to handle?

title: Chaplain Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was interview by two people in the Spiritual Care Department and each person was concerned with different aspects of my education and experience.  Most of the questions asked were about my knowledge of chaplaincy, my theology, my ability to serve people with different beliefs and my availability
Interview Questions: What experience do you bring to the job?

title: HIM Coder Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC)
Interview Descriptions: submit application on line , HR company matches your skills with job applied for and contacts manager in the department to identify you as a candidate.  HR company does preliminary interview before contacting manager. Manager contacts you to set up skills testing and further interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cone Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with recruiter 2 separate times then in person panel interview. Well organized. Easy to follow instructions. Lengthy process though.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: X-ray Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Casual, short, to the point. I was relaxed and the interviewers were not intimidating. They were open to my questions and explained everything. I was also given a thourough tour of the facility. I was introduced to faculty and everyone was inviting.
Interview Questions: What could you bring to the company?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was organized and very thorough
Interview Questions: How do you make friends

title: Admission Service Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC)
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was lengthy due to the size of the company. It's not hard, but many steps. Application, HR interview, Skill testing, hiring manager interview, team interview, orientation...It's well worth it, but helps to know someone who currently works here... People were very nice and professional. Overall it was a great experience, just takes patience...
Interview Questions: So, tell me about yourself....

title: Clinic Triage Regeistered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: It took about 5 interviews with Cone's hiring department, phone interview, office manager, nursing supervisor, and back to the hiring department. It took a few trips to the hiring office to complete the entire process, initial information gathering where you had to fill out hard copies to give them all the information you had already provided online, another trip to take tests, another trip to provide additional paperwork they requested, another trip for orientation, etc.
Interview Questions: There weren't any difficult or unexpected questions, it was all pretty straight forward

title: Office of Patient Experience Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had a brief telephone interview and at the end of the interview, I was invited to interview in person. Once I completed that interview, I was required to complete several tasks and upon completion, I was offered the internship. The entire process took about 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Do you enjoy working with the public?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Spoke over the phone and set up an interview. Interviewed with Director for 20 minutes, then with 3 staff members for 20 minutes. I shodowed the floor for 1 hour.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses?

title: Nurse Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted first by cone to do a personality assessment. After that was completed, I was emailed about a setting up a phone interview. I received a call from a recruiter at a set time, who asked me a few intitial questions and told me I sounded like a good candidate. She set up an interview with my director and I met with her. It went well and I was offered a position with Cone Health. All of this happened within 1 week.

Up until this point, everything was great.

I was told they had all my information and was given the go ahead to put in my two week notice at my current employer. After that, I had call after call from the cone recruiters who could not seem to find certain paperwork, time after time. I tturns out they use a company in Wisconsin to contract out their human resource department. After all was said and done, I ended up receiving calls from 12 different ladies (I counted) that worked for Pinstripe (the contract company 900 miles away).

It was as if my application, background check, etc. was all on an assembly line and no one was talking to each other. 

If I had not put my two weeks notice in already, I would have told Cone to forget it. I was out of work for two weeks because they kept pushing my start date back. I am currently going back to my old job because this situation seems like "par for the course" at Cone health overall.
Interview Questions: Can you start you orientation two weeks later than we agreed upon?

title: Allied Health Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cone Health (Greensboro, NC) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: First, there was a phone interview with the department manager followed by and interview with an HR representative, this was followed by an in person interview with the department manager and with other members of the department, this was Open and non intimidating, all members of department participated, had to complete a case study
Interview Questions: Case study, describe experience

title: Care Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cone Health (Raleigh, NC) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: I got online to complete a job search after being laid off. I saw position for full time care manager and applied. I also submitted my current resume. I received an email to set up a phone screening with talent acquisition. After that I received a call and set up interview with hiring manager.
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in 5 years?
